page.title: 05EDUCATION
page.content: HISTORY The school was built in 1843 by the Lord Mayor and Aldermen of the City of London in their capacity of Trustees of Emanuel Hospital. THE SCHOOL TODAY The school caters for children aged 5 to 11. Some have to travel over 5 miles and are conveyed by mini-bus. At present there are about 90 plus children on roll. There are 4 full time teachers plus 1 part time teacher. CURRICULUM This includes Maths. English,R.E. History, Geography, Music and Games. SECONDARY EDUCATION At the age of 11 the children transfer to Hornsea School.
